content.rendered:
Check out March events happening around Colorado! As the ski season comes to a close, there are lots of great events happening around Colorado. Check out some of these exciting events and activities.

Denver:

Denver Auto Show, March 21

Located at the Colorado Convention Center, the Denver Auto Show is the premier showcase of the newest model year of import and domestic vehicles. You will not only see the latest and greatest in the auto world but, you’ll also be treated to sneak peeks of the hottest and newest concept cars and tricked out sports cars and trucks!

St. Patrick's Day Parade, March 16

The parade fills the sidewalks of Blake Street with residents of the city. Most of whom are wearing some sort of green clothing, as well as a myriad of other St. Patty’s Day apparel to celebrate the Irish.

Denver Restaurant Week, February 23-March 8

Come celebrate food! Denver Restaurant Week is a two-week celebration of the culinary scene in Denver. All participating restaurants will offer a multi-course dinner for the fixed price of $52.80 for two, or $26.40 for one.

Vail:

Pink Vail, March 9th

Come join us for the world’s largest ski and ride event in support of the Shaw Regional Cancer Center. The event will feature lots of skiing and riding, après party, and concerts to benefit cancer survivorship.  Following the benefit, a free concert by Charlie Mars will be held at the base of Lionshead.

10th Annual Vail Film Festival, March 28-31

Festival activities include film screenings, panel discussions, live music, and a filmmaker reception. Come witness the history of Vail and its founding as it unfolds during the 50th anniversary film by Roger Cotton Brown, Vail's original filmmaker.  Tickets are available at the Lionshead Welcome Center on the day of the show only.

Breckenridge:

St. Patrick's Day, March 16

Get ready to have a blast in Breckenridge this St. Patrick’s Day!  There will be many drink specials around town at various bars and restaurants. St. Patty's day is sure to be a big hit in Breck this year!

Avalanche Education Series, March 21

Interested in Avalanche safety? The Breckenridge Ski Patrol is holding a free public avalanche education series. This education series is free to everyone with free food, door prizes. This is a great opportunity for learning about avalanche safety in and around the 10 Mile Range.

The Five Peaks, March 23

Witness North America’s highest ski mountaineering race taking place in the Ten Mile Range at Breckenridge Ski Resort. This incredible race features racers ascending and descending all four peaks at Breckenridge, plus for the first time ever the race will include Peak 6.

Steamboat Springs:

 

Torchlight Parade and Fireworks Display, March 17

Come join us for Steamboat’s monthly parade and fireworks show. The Steamboat Ski and Snowboard School treats visitors to a spectacular on-snow parade and a firework display to illuminate the sky providing a perfect ending to the evening.

Bud Light Rocks the Boat Free Concert Series, March 9, 16, 23, & 30

The ongoing winter concert series takes place at Steamboat Ski Resort and will be rockin' its Golden Anniversary season. This event offers a great mixture of various musical genres for everyone to enjoy.

If you're in Colorado this month, be sure to check out all of the amazing events near you!  Looking for more to do?  AVA has opened ziplining at our Idaho Springs Outpost for Saturdays and Sundays this March.  It's the perfect way to enjoy the sunshine!
